questions.question_text_1: General Instructions:  (i) There are two sections in the question paper. All questions are compulsory.  (ii) Question numbers 3 to 5 are long-answer type questions each carrying 5 marks. The word limit and marks for each question are mentioned alongside it. The answers can be short and to the point. So, think for 80% of the time and the remaining 20% for typing.  Refrain from looking at the neighbouring candidate's screen and reproducing their answers. Such behaviour is easily detectable and may attract penalties. Please be mindful that irrelevant answers, responding with unrelated content or duplicating information already provided in the question paper will not earn you marks. Ensure that your responses are supported with relevant content from the course, incorporating theories and/or suitable examples to demonstrate their application in the given case study/ scenario.  (iii) Question numbers 6 to 25, are Multiple choice questions each carrying one mark. Read the instructions carefully and choose the closest and correct option; there is only one right answer for each question.
question_texts: General Instructions:  (i) There are two sections in the question paper. All questions are compulsory. (iii) Question numbers 6 to 25, are Multiple choice questions each carrying one mark. Read the instructions carefully and choose the closest and correct option; there is only one right answer for each question.

options.option_text: This Instructions is just for a reference & not for an evaluation.

questions.question_text_1: Based on the Week 5 case study, PEOPLEFIRST INC.: A STAR EMPLOYEE BUT A TERRIBLE MANAGER in the course, answer this question in approximately 150-200 words. Ensure that your responses are supported with relevant content from the course and the case study.  Synopsis: PeopleFirst was a management consulting company founded and run by Renne Janssen. Janssen had recently promoted a star employee, Marcela Lopez, to the position of manager. However, Lopez’s first foray into management was turning into a disaster… Lopez’s team lacked psychological safety. Janssen was faced with the challenge of determining how to persuade Lopez to become a more effective manager and how to increase the morale of the employees in Lopez’s team…  [PeopleFirst] You had identified components of emotional intelligence that Lopez is strong in. Mention areas in which she could improve and some actions she could take to improve upon these components. Guidelines: Use the 6R framework to advise Lopez on how to improve.

questions.question_text_1: Based on the Week 5 case study, PEOPLEFIRST INC.: A STAR EMPLOYEE BUT A TERRIBLE MANAGER in the course, answer this question in approximately 150-200 words. Ensure that your responses are supported with relevant content from the course and the case study.  Synopsis: PeopleFirst was a management consulting company founded and run by Renne Janssen. Janssen had recently promoted a star employee, Marcela Lopez, to the position of manager. However, Lopez’s first foray into management was turning into a disaster… Lopez’s team lacked psychological safety. Janssen was faced with the challenge of determining how to persuade Lopez to become a more effective manager and how to increase the morale of the employees in Lopez’s team…  [PeopleFirst] From the case study, what behaviours might indicate that psychological safety was absent in the team led by Lopez? Guidelines: Provide three instances from the case study that you have analyzed and explain why they led to low levels of psychological safety.

questions.question_text_1: Based on the Week 5 case study, PEOPLEFIRST INC.: A STAR EMPLOYEE BUT A TERRIBLE MANAGER in the course, answer this question in approximately 150-200 words. Ensure that your responses are supported with relevant content from the course and the case study.  Synopsis: PeopleFirst was a management consulting company founded and run by Renne Janssen. Janssen had recently promoted a star employee, Marcela Lopez, to the position of manager. However, Lopez’s first foray into management was turning into a disaster… Lopez’s team lacked psychological safety. Janssen was faced with the challenge of determining how to persuade Lopez to become a more effective manager and how to increase the morale of the employees in Lopez’s team…  [PeopleFirst] Out of the two options available to Lopez — (i) salvaging her career at PeopleFirst or (ii) looking outside — what do you think Lopez must do?  Guidelines: Choose an option and justify your response with reasons or suitable examples.

questions.question_text_1: Stages of Team Development  Identify each stage of the team based on scenarios from the options below: a. Forming b. Storming c. Norming d. Performing e. Terminating  Based on the above data answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: [Stages of Team Development] After several meetings and facilitated discussions, the team agrees on a cohesive marketing strategy that incorporates elements of both traditional and innovative approaches. Team members start to collaborate more effectively, sharing ideas and supporting each other's contributions.

questions.question_text_1: Caselet: At a large corporation, the CEO implements a new company-wide policy aimed at improving employee well-being. However, as the policy trickles down through the organization, it gets distorted and misinterpreted at various levels. Employees at lower tiers feel disconnected and misunderstood, leading to decreased morale and productivity.  Which communication phenomenon is evident in this scenario?
question_texts: Caselet: At a large corporation, the CEO implements a new company-wide policy aimed at improving employee well-being. However, as the policy trickles down through the organization, it gets distorted and misinterpreted at various levels. Employees at lower tiers feel disconnected and misunderstood, leading to decreased morale and productivity.  Which communication phenomenon is evident in this scenario?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following best describes the "elation phase" in the process of culture shock?
question_texts: Which of the following best describes the "elation phase" in the process of culture shock?

options.option_text: Feelings of discomfort and disorientation as one struggles to adapt.
Intense excitement and fascination with the new culture.
Gradual adjustment and acceptance of the new culture's norms and values.
Emotional withdrawal and longing for familiarity.

question_texts: _______ occurs when aggregate demand in an economy is more than aggregate supply.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements about opportunity costs is true?  1. The opportunity cost of a given action is equal to the value foregone of all feasible alternative actions. 2. Opportunity costs only measure direct out-of-pocket expenditures. 3. To calculate accurately the opportunity cost of an action we need to first identify the next best alternative to that action. Select the correct option:

Select the correct option:

question_texts: Which statement about fixed-rate and variable-rate interest loans is false?

options.option_text: Interest on fixed-rate loans stays the same for the life of the loan.
Interest on variable-rate loans can fluctuate, which could affect the paymentsyou must make.
Interest rates on fixed-rate loans are usually lower than starting rates onvariable-rate loans.
Fixed-rate loans offer more stability and predictability in interest paymentscompared to variable-rate loans.

options.option_text: Telepathically transmitting quiz answers to your friend in the exam centre.

props.summary:
### Summary of Core Topics, Concepts, Principles, and Equations

#### Core Topics and Concepts

1. **Emotional Intelligence and Leadership**
   - Components of Emotional Intelligence
   - 6R Framework for Improvement
   - Psychological Safety in Teams

2. **Team Development Stages**
   - Forming, Storming, Norming, Performing, Terminating
   - Characteristics and Examples of Each Stage

3. **Change Management**
   - Change Planning
   - Change Implementation
   - Continuous Improvement Post-Change

4. **Communication**
   - Semantic Barriers
   - Active Listening
   - Downward Communication
   - Appearance of Business Documents

5. **Cultural Strategies**
   - Cultural Dominance
   - Cultural Avoidance
   - Cultural Compromise
   - Cultural Accommodation
   - Cultural Synergy

6. **Economic Concepts**
   - Demand-Pull Inflation
   - Opportunity Costs
   - Fixed-Rate and Variable-Rate Interest Loans

7. **Insurance and Income**
   - Premiums
   - Types of Income

8. **Personal Development**
   - Leading Yourself from Within
   - Multiple Intelligence Framework by Howard Gardner

#### Important Principles and Equations

1. **Social Loafing**
   - As the size of a team increases, individuals are more likely to decrease their effort in contributing towards the task.

2. **Opportunity Costs**
   - Opportunity Cost = Value of the Next Best Alternative

3. **Inflation**
   - Demand-Pull Inflation: Aggregate Demand > Aggregate Supply

#### Knowledge Graph 

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A[Emotional Intelligence] --> B[Components of Emotional Intelligence]
    A --> C[6R Framework]
    A --> D[Psychological Safety]
    E[Team Development] --> F[Forming]
    E --> G[Storming]
    E --> H[Norming]
    E --> I[Performing]
    E --> J[Terminating]
    K[Change Management] --> L[Change Planning]
    K --> M[Change Implementation]
    K --> N[Continuous Improvement]
    O[Communication] --> P[Semantic Barriers]
    O --> Q[Active Listening]
    O --> R[Downward Communication]
    O --> S[Appearance of Business Documents]
    T[Cultural Strategies] --> U[Cultural Dominance]
    T --> V[Cultural Avoidance]
    T --> W[Cultural Compromise]
    T --> X[Cultural Accommodation]
    T --> Y[Cultural Synergy]
    Z[Economic Concepts] --> AA[Demand-Pull Inflation]
    Z --> AB[Opportunity Costs]
    Z --> AC[Fixed-Rate and Variable-Rate Interest Loans]
    AD[Insurance and Income] --> AE[Premiums]
    AD --> AF[Types of Income]
    AG[Personal Development] --> AH[Leading Yourself from Within]
    AG --> AI[Multiple Intelligence Framework]
```

This summary and knowledge graph should help you focus on the essential topics and understand the relationships between them for your exam preparation.
